content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find the ArXiv Blog on the ArXiv website and summarize the content of its latest article.  Please interact with https://arxiv.org/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is no direct link to the ArXiv Blog visible in the top navigation or main content. Additional sections or a footer might contain a blog link, so I need to scroll down to look for a "Blog" or similar section.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is still no visible link or section for the ArXiv Blog. The page appears to list categories and subfields. Additional scrolling may be necessary to find the blog link, typically found in the footer or a separate section further down.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current section still lists only categories and does not show any link to a blog or blog-related content. As footer sections often contain such links, I should continue scrolling down to search for the ArXiv Blog link.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: In the "About arXiv" section, there is still no direct link labeled as "Blog" or similar. The footer is visible with several general links, but none appear to reference the ArXiv Blog. There may be another homepage, or a different navigation area. "General information" could lead to additional resources, possibly including a blog.
Action: Click 29
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current page is about "Submission Guidelines" and does not feature a blog or links to blog content. There is a search box in the navigation bar, which can be utilized to search for "blog" and potentially find the ArXiv Blog.
Action: Type 3; blog
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search for "blog" led to a page about "Trackbacks," which are not the ArXiv Blog, but a technical feature related to blog software. No apparent links to ArXiv's official blog are present. I should try searching for "ArXiv Blog" specifically in the site's search to see if there is a dedicated section or news/blog page.
Action: Type 3; ArXiv Blog
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search led to the "About arXiv" section, but there is now a "News" link (element 5) in the sidebar/table of contents. The blog might be categorized under news or linked from there.
Action: Click 5
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "arXiv Blog" link (element 9) is now clearly visible under the News section. Clicking this will likely lead directly to the official ArXiv Blog, where I can locate the latest article and summarize its content.
Action: Click 9
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.8

content:
Thought: The latest article on the ArXiv Blog is titled "Attention Authors: Upcoming Scheduled Maintenance to arxiv.org," published on September 16, 2025. The visible summary mentions scheduled maintenance on September 17th, 2025, between 7AM and 9AM EDT, during which most site functions that require login will be disabled. To ensure I capture the full content, I should click "CONTINUE READING."
Action: Click 9
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.9

content:
Thought: The full article content is now partially visible, with the main heading, author, date, and tags. The article explains that arXiv’s database will be down for scheduled maintenance on September 17th, 2025, between 7AM and 9AM EDT. During this period, it will be possible to browse and search, but all functions requiring log-in (such as submissions and account management) will be disabled. To ensure I capture the entire content, I should scroll down to read the article in full.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.95

content:
Thought: The full content of the latest ArXiv Blog article is now visible. It informs users about scheduled maintenance on September 17th, 2025, from 7AM to 9AM EDT. During this time, the website will remain accessible for browsing, viewing, and searching papers, but all functions that require logging in—such as submissions, account editing, and endorsement—will be disabled. The update is expected to take two hours, and timely updates will be provided via the status page (https://status.arxiv.org).

Action: ANSWER; The latest article on the ArXiv Blog (published September 16, 2025) announces a scheduled maintenance for the arXiv database on September 17th, 2025, from 7AM to 9AM EDT. While users will still be able to browse, view, and search papers during this window, all services requiring a login (including submissions, account changes, and endorsements) will be unavailable. The maintenance is expected to last two hours, and updates will be posted on https://status.arxiv.org.
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 1.0
token: : ANSWER; The latest article on the ArXiv Blog (published September 16, 2025) announces a scheduled maintenance for the arXiv database on September 17th, 2025, from 7AM to 9AM EDT. While users will still be able to browse, view, and search papers during this window, all services requiring a login (including submissions, account changes, and endorsements) will be unavailable. The maintenance is expected to last two hours, and updates will be posted on https://status.arxiv.org
